description: Unique ID assigned to each employee
Name of the employee
Contact number of the employee
Email address of the employee
Residential address of the employee
Name of the town where the employee resides
Name of the province where the employee resides
Position or job title of the employee
Unique ID assigned to each visit
ID of the location visited
ID of the water source visited
Date and time of the visit
Number of visits made to this location
Time spent by people waiting for water in a queue at the location
ID of the employee who visited the location
Unique ID assigned to each record
Score representing the subjective quality of the water source
Number of visits made for data collection
Unique ID assigned to each water source
Type or category of the water source. Can be : tap_in_home, tap_in_home_broken, well, shared_tap, river
Number of people served by this water source
ID of the water source being tested for pollution
Date of the pollution test
Description of the pollution test
Result of the pollution test in parts per million
Biological contamination level
Result of the pollution test. Can be 'dirty', 'biologically contaminated', or 'clean'

Address of the location
Name of the province where the location is situated
Name of the town where the location is situated
Type or category of the location
The country or area name
Geographical region
Year of the data record
The national population size estimate in thousands
The urban population share estimate in percentage points (%)

The estimated national share of people with surface service (%)
